related.meaning: terdiri dari; bersifat praktis (logis, layak, dapat diterapkan), dapat disimpulkan, berlaku benar.
berdiri terbalik, berdiri di atas kepala

lessons.japanese: 来週彼女のところに立ち寄るつもりだ。
lessons.indonesian: I'm going to drop in on her next week.

lessons.japanese: 彼らはよく私の家にひょっこり立ち寄る。
lessons.indonesian: They often drop in at my house.

lessons.japanese: 彼らはしばしば我々のところへ立ち寄る。
lessons.indonesian: They often drop in to see us.

lessons.japanese: 彼は途中できっと私たちのところに立ち寄るはずだ。
lessons.indonesian: He is bound to drop in on us on his way.

lessons.japanese: 彼は外出するたびに、その本屋に立ち寄る。
lessons.indonesian: Every time he goes out, he drops in at the bookstore.

lessons.japanese: 私は東京に行くときいつも彼女の家に立ち寄る。
lessons.indonesian: I always drop in at her house when I go to Tokyo.

lessons.japanese: 私は家に帰る途中でその本屋に立ち寄るのが常であった。
lessons.indonesian: I used to drop in at the bookstore on my way home.

lessons.japanese: 私が立ち寄ると決まっていつも、うるさくまとわりついてくる。
lessons.indonesian: Every time I drop in to visit, they constantly get in my hair.

lessons.japanese: 私が立ち寄ると決まっていつも、うるさくまとわりついてくる。
lessons.indonesian: Every time I drop in to visit, they constantly get in my hair.

lessons.japanese: 私は家に帰る途中でその本屋に立ち寄るのが常であった。
lessons.indonesian: I used to drop in at the bookstore on my way home.

lessons.japanese: 私は東京に行くときいつも彼女の家に立ち寄る。
lessons.indonesian: I always drop in at her house when I go to Tokyo.

lessons.japanese: 彼は外出するたびに、その本屋に立ち寄る。
lessons.indonesian: Every time he goes out, he drops in at the bookstore.

lessons.japanese: 彼は途中できっと私たちのところに立ち寄るはずだ。
lessons.indonesian: He is bound to drop in on us on his way.
